author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
On the Ruqqus website itself, usually it's seen as a good thing to give constructive feedback on something. However in the Discord, most people practically worship the admins, and the mods too, and treat them like gods of Ruqqus or something. They're always the center of everything, and you don't dare oppose even one thing they do or else everyone gets in a hivemind and shits all over you for it. This is starting to look like the same kind of cult mentality that AHS has, and I don't think that's healthy for Ruqqus. I think some of the admins and mods are even starting to believe it and now think they're superior to others because of it, and that will undoubtedly lead to power abuse.

Anyone know why the discord users are doing this?
body_html:
On the Ruqqus website itself, usually it's seen as a good thing to give constructive feedback on something. However in the Discord, most people practically worship the admins, and the mods too, and treat them like gods of Ruqqus or something. They're always the center of everything, and you don't dare oppose even one thing they do or else everyone gets in a hivemind and shits all over you for it. This is starting to look like the same kind of cult mentality that AHS has, and I don't think that's healthy for Ruqqus. I think some of the admins and mods are even starting to believe it and now think they're superior to others because of it, and that will undoubtedly lead to power abuse.

Anyone know why the discord users are doing this?

guild.description:
For memes and shitposting about everything that happens in our beloved "Official Ruqqus Discord"
 
---

## Posting Rules


Rule 1: 

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +askruqqus, +general, or +hub would gladly accept your questions.


Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

* Same-format posting within a day

* Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)


Spammed posts will get kicked and repeated offenses results in being exiled.


Rule 3: 

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.
guild.description_html:
For memes and shitposting about everything that happens in our beloved "Official Ruqqus Discord"

Posting Rules

Rule 1:

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +AskRuqqus, +general, or +Hub would gladly accept your questions.

Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

  • Same-format posting within a day

  • Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)

Spammed posts will get kicked and repeated offenses results in being exiled.

Rule 3:

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.
guild.name: RuqqusDiscord

title: Why do people worship the admins and mods so much?

body:
All discord servers are made and used for mod drama

I've seen too much to know this is true

body: Because they have to deal with a lot of dumbasses. Also the discord has stricter rules than the website because we have to follow discord tos.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
That's why the admins are stricter on the discord. It doesn't explain why people worship them and the mods all the time.

I should also mention that the admins let the mods do whatever they want and break all the rules they want for the most part and they're completely fine with it, even though everyone else has to follow them. This is the same kind of double standard reddit has, so I think all the exaltation of them from the users in the server is making them actually believe it. That's the kind of thing that will make them proud, which will not end well. This is why pride is evil.

That's why the admins are stricter on the discord. It doesn't explain why people worship them and the mods all the time.

That's the kind of thing that will make them proud, which will not end well. This is why pride is evil.

post.title: Why do people worship the admins and mods so much?

body:
Is this new? It certainly wasn’t the case when I was a member of the discord. 

No one is immune to criticism if it’s framed in certain ways, for example saying “you’re a shit mod” is going to achieve a lot less than “I think this decision or your action here is wrong”.
body_html:
Is this new? It certainly wasn’t the case when I was a member of the discord.

No one is immune to criticism if it’s framed in certain ways, for example saying “you’re a shit mod” is going to achieve a lot less than “I think this decision or your action here is wrong”.

body:
It's not when you talk shit to them like that. You disagree with one thing they do and everyone gives you so much shit for it. The general atmosphere from most users seems to be that the mods there are the gods of ruqqus or something who can do no wrong and everyone should follow them around all the time, and I think some of them are actually starting to believe in their own supposed inherent superiority and becoming prideful of it, which will not be good for avoiding power abuse. It's literally idolatry. Apparently the mods are also allowed to break the rules of the server (though most don't), and the admins are 100% in support of that even though everyone else has to follow them strictly, and most of the users are on board with that setup too, and you can't even disagree with that without getting a ton of hate. There are other things too, like admins seemingly showing favoritism towards certain users (who "coincidentally" all happen to have become mods of the discord server at some point), on both the main website and the discord server. Totally haven't seen that anywhere else before, have we?

I don't see why the admins and especially the users are okay with having those kinds of double standards. Every time it's brought up people in the server just dismiss it as either a "lunatic conspiracy theory" or "it's not a big enough issue to fix". Whereas on Ruqqus itself almost everyone agrees that this is a major problem if we don't want to go down the same path as reddit.
body_html:
It's not when you talk shit to them like that. You disagree with one thing they do and everyone gives you so much shit for it. The general atmosphere from most users seems to be that the mods there are the gods of ruqqus or something who can do no wrong and everyone should follow them around all the time, and I think some of them are actually starting to believe in their own supposed inherent superiority and becoming prideful of it, which will not be good for avoiding power abuse. It's literally idolatry. Apparently the mods are also allowed to break the rules of the server (though most don't), and the admins are 100% in support of that even though everyone else has to follow them strictly, and most of the users are on board with that setup too, and you can't even disagree with that without getting a ton of hate. There are other things too, like admins seemingly showing favoritism towards certain users (who "coincidentally" all happen to have become mods of the discord server at some point), on both the main website and the discord server. Totally haven't seen that anywhere else before, have we?

I don't see why the admins and especially the users are okay with having those kinds of double standards. Every time it's brought up people in the server just dismiss it as either a "lunatic conspiracy theory" or "it's not a big enough issue to fix". Whereas on Ruqqus itself almost everyone agrees that this is a major problem if we don't want to go down the same path as reddit.

parent.body:
Is this new? It certainly wasn’t the case when I was a member of the discord. 

No one is immune to criticism if it’s framed in certain ways, for example saying “you’re a shit mod” is going to achieve a lot less than “I think this decision or your action here is wrong”.
parent.body_html:
Is this new? It certainly wasn’t the case when I was a member of the discord.

No one is immune to criticism if it’s framed in certain ways, for example saying “you’re a shit mod” is going to achieve a lot less than “I think this decision or your action here is wrong”.

post.body:
On the Ruqqus website itself, usually it's seen as a good thing to give constructive feedback on something. However in the Discord, most people practically worship the admins, and the mods too, and treat them like gods of Ruqqus or something. They're always the center of everything, and you don't dare oppose even one thing they do or else everyone gets in a hivemind and shits all over you for it. This is starting to look like the same kind of cult mentality that AHS has, and I don't think that's healthy for Ruqqus. I think some of the admins and mods are even starting to believe it and now think they're superior to others because of it, and that will undoubtedly lead to power abuse.

Anyone know why the discord users are doing this?
post.body_html:
On the Ruqqus website itself, usually it's seen as a good thing to give constructive feedback on something. However in the Discord, most people practically worship the admins, and the mods too, and treat them like gods of Ruqqus or something. They're always the center of everything, and you don't dare oppose even one thing they do or else everyone gets in a hivemind and shits all over you for it. This is starting to look like the same kind of cult mentality that AHS has, and I don't think that's healthy for Ruqqus. I think some of the admins and mods are even starting to believe it and now think they're superior to others because of it, and that will undoubtedly lead to power abuse.

Anyone know why the discord users are doing this?
post.title: Why do people worship the admins and mods so much?

body:
I don't feel as if I am given any special treatment by users or admin. Sure some of our mods are treated nicely (if you know you know) but I attribute that to their personality, kindness, and other similar factors.

On another note that I would like all people here to please remember: Mods and admins are still users of the server too. We want to be able to converse and hang out with you all just like regular users. Please, do not treat us any differently simply due to our roles on the server. I think I speak for all mods/admin when I say that.
body_html:
I don't feel as if I am given any special treatment by users or admin. Sure some of our mods are treated nicely (if you know you know) but I attribute that to their personality, kindness, and other similar factors.

On another note that I would like all people here to please remember: Mods and admins are still users of the server too. We want to be able to converse and hang out with you all just like regular users. Please, do not treat us any differently simply due to our roles on the server. I think I speak for all mods/admin when I say that.

body:

author.bio: I like big brains and I cannot lie.
author.bio_html: I like big brains and I cannot lie.

body:
>I should also mention that the admins let the mods do whatever they want and break all the rules they want for the most part and they're completely fine with it, even though everyone else has to follow them. 

Mods should not be breaking rules. I think it’s more likely that the admins aren’t catching when these rules are broken.

There have been instances when admins and sometimes other mods have had to remind a mod not to break a rule in the mod channel. 

Mods are users of the server and sometimes we get carried away. That said, I can assure you that admins want all users to follow the rules (including mods)
body_html:
I should also mention that the admins let the mods do whatever they want and break all the rules they want for the most part and they're completely fine with it, even though everyone else has to follow them.

Mods should not be breaking rules. I think it’s more likely that the admins aren’t catching when these rules are broken.

There have been instances when admins and sometimes other mods have had to remind a mod not to break a rule in the mod channel.

Mods are users of the server and sometimes we get carried away. That said, I can assure you that admins want all users to follow the rules (including mods)

parent.body:
That's why the admins are stricter on the discord. It doesn't explain why people worship them and the mods all the time.

I should also mention that the admins let the mods do whatever they want and break all the rules they want for the most part and they're completely fine with it, even though everyone else has to follow them. This is the same kind of double standard reddit has, so I think all the exaltation of them from the users in the server is making them actually believe it. That's the kind of thing that will make them proud, which will not end well. This is why pride is evil.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
Just the general attitude. It seems to be the exact opposite here as it is on discord, and I was getting at the mob mentality because it has a long history or causing problems on sites like this one.

If this were a normal site I wouldn't think anything of it, but I'm very surprised it happens here because most of us came to escape that mindset on another site that also begins with an r. Ruqqus as a whole is generally opposed to that kind of mentality. Then again discord probably attracts a different kind of audience than a forum.
body_html:
Just the general attitude. It seems to be the exact opposite here as it is on discord, and I was getting at the mob mentality because it has a long history or causing problems on sites like this one.

If this were a normal site I wouldn't think anything of it, but I'm very surprised it happens here because most of us came to escape that mindset on another site that also begins with an r. Ruqqus as a whole is generally opposed to that kind of mentality. Then again discord probably attracts a different kind of audience than a forum.

guild.name: RuqqusDiscord

post.body:
On the Ruqqus website itself, usually it's seen as a good thing to give constructive feedback on something. However in the Discord, most people practically worship the admins, and the mods too, and treat them like gods of Ruqqus or something. They're always the center of everything, and you don't dare oppose even one thing they do or else everyone gets in a hivemind and shits all over you for it. This is starting to look like the same kind of cult mentality that AHS has, and I don't think that's healthy for Ruqqus. I think some of the admins and mods are even starting to believe it and now think they're superior to others because of it, and that will undoubtedly lead to power abuse.

Anyone know why the discord users are doing this?
post.body_html:
On the Ruqqus website itself, usually it's seen as a good thing to give constructive feedback on something. However in the Discord, most people practically worship the admins, and the mods too, and treat them like gods of Ruqqus or something. They're always the center of everything, and you don't dare oppose even one thing they do or else everyone gets in a hivemind and shits all over you for it. This is starting to look like the same kind of cult mentality that AHS has, and I don't think that's healthy for Ruqqus. I think some of the admins and mods are even starting to believe it and now think they're superior to others because of it, and that will undoubtedly lead to power abuse.

Anyone know why the discord users are doing this?
post.title: Why do people worship the admins and mods so much?

guild.description:
For memes and shitposting about everything that happens in our beloved "Official Ruqqus Discord"
 
---

## Posting Rules


Rule 1: 

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +askruqqus, +general, or +hub would gladly accept your questions.


Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

* Same-format posting within a day

* Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)


Spammed posts will get kicked and repeated offenses results in being exiled.


Rule 3: 

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.
guild.description_html:
For memes and shitposting about everything that happens in our beloved "Official Ruqqus Discord"

Posting Rules

Rule 1:

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +AskRuqqus, +general, or +Hub would gladly accept your questions.

Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

  • Same-format posting within a day

  • Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)

Spammed posts will get kicked and repeated offenses results in being exiled.

Rule 3:

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.
